greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of k-ascent sequences of length n with no consecutive repeated letters; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
S. Kitaev, J. Remmel, p-Ascent Sequences, arXiv:1503.00914 [math.CO], 2015.
maple: b:= proc(n, k, i, t) option remember; `if`(n<1, 1, add(
mathematica: b[n_, k_, i_, t_] := b[n, k, i, t] = If[n<1, 1, Sum[If[j == i, 0, b[n-1, k, j, t + If[j>i, 1, 0]]], {j, 0, t+k}]]; A[n_, k_] := b[n-1, k, 0, 0]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 17 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 28 2015
